SUMMARY: During anaerobiosis, TdcR participates in controlling several genes involved in transport and metabolism of threonine and serine [2573820, 11251844, 7928991]. TdcR has a helix-turn-helix motif that shows 25% and 35% identity to same motifs of transcriptional regulators NtrC and Fis, respectively [2573820]. It appears that due to fact that tdcR gene shows poor codon usage and a poor Shine-Dalgarno sequence, it is weakly expressed [2573820]. tdcR is transcribed alone and is located divergently in genome from operon (tdcABCD), whose transcription is activated by TdcR. first gene of operon codes for TdcA, a transcriptional regulator that probably interacts with TdcR to activate transcription of operon [7928991] and se two proteins appear to function toger with CRP and IHF, proteins that bend DNA, for this activation [11251844]. tdc: threonine dehydratase [6327641].
